unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, FESTIVAL! Your Guide to the Wonderful World of Film Festivals
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, FESTIVAL! Your Guide to the Wonderful World of Film Festivals

unnormalised: Hey folks! Ever feel like you're stuck in a Bollywood rerun and craving something… different? Well, let me tell you, film festivals are your ticket to cinematic nirvana! They're not just for serious cinephiles sipping chai and discussing Eisenstein, though there's definitely room for that too!

unnormalised: Think of film festivals as a giant buffet of stories from all corners of the globe. From the prestigious Jio MAMI Mumbai Film Festival showcasing the best of Indian and international cinema to smaller, more niche festivals in places like Kochi or Pune, there's a fest for every taste. You might stumble upon a groundbreaking documentary, a quirky indie comedy, or even a chilling thriller from, say, a director in Kerala.

unnormalised: What’s the big deal, you ask? Well, film festivals are where tomorrow's stars are discovered. Remember that scene in *Om Shanti Om* where everyone's vying for attention at the premiere? Film festivals can be like that, but with even more raw talent and less dramatic chandelier collapses (hopefully!). They offer filmmakers a platform to showcase their work, network with industry professionals, and maybe, just maybe, get that big break.

unnormalised: Attending a film festival is an experience in itself. Imagine catching back-to-back screenings, participating in Q&A sessions with the filmmakers, and debating the merits of a particular film over steaming cups of filter coffee at a nearby chai stall. Plus, you get to see films that might never make it to your local multiplex. Think of it as uncovering hidden gems!

unnormalised: Planning to attend one? Keep an eye out for announcements around October-November, festival season usually kicks off then. Check out websites like filmfreeway.com for a list of festivals and submission guidelines (if you're a filmmaker, of course!). And remember to book your tickets in advance! Some popular festivals, like the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, get packed quickly. Budget around Rs. 5000-Rs. 10000 for travel and accommodation, depending on the location and duration. Some festivals even offer student discounts! So, grab your popcorn (or samosas, we’re in India after all!), and get ready for a cinematic adventure! Who knows, you might just discover your new favourite film. Happy watching!
